content.description:
Rennak's Delight has some of the best bouldery movement I've done at the grade in the area, despite being not much to look at and lowball. If there were a couple of intro moves to get the problem off the deck, it would be killer, but it's still fun as is.

From a SDS, huck to the lip, control the swing, and make a few campusy or extended moves before a hard lip pull, likely exiting slightly left.

8a.nu grades

.

Beta:

vimeo.com/83466817

- as usual, there are multiple ways to do this one. It's possible to make the top not a grovel, but that takes some sorting ... as I learned sliding off a beached whale attempt.
content.location: It is adjacent to the cave at the back of the lowball zone. Standing at the base of the problem, you'll be looking directly at The Shaft, Milk Bone, etc.

content.description: Via "Colorado Bouldering Front Range": "start down and right and traverse across the face to a frustrating, sloping, lip arete topout."
content.protection: A pad or two - it is pretty low to the ground.
content.location: Continue past Edging Edgio, V8. Stay on the trail, and it should be just off the trail on your right.
